column4: ok i need someone to SERIOUSLY help me now. Yesterday I was on for three hours trying to figure out why i couldn't install anything from command line or use the update manager. Turns out it's because for some reason the system wouldn't let go of the Tor proxy i set systemwide. Even though I went into Network Proxy and disabled it system wide, it STILL looks for it. Ebb found this link: http://burakdd.wordpress.com/2009/08/24/removing-proxy-server-fro
m-ubuntu-9-04/ which tells me to run this command: unset http_proxy. I ran it and it worked. Now the problem has started up again, and that command won't fix it...so what the??? o.0
marfi, can u help me then? :D
anyone have any idea why the system proxy simply WON'T go away and keeps blocking me from doing anything?
anyone able to help me? o.0 :(
ANYONE?!??? :(
whats a system proxy
the system proxy is a proxy you can set on the system
the proxy works via environment
i know how the proxy works, what i don't know is why it just won't turn off
tor proxy is localhost? do "set |grep localhost" in a console and then it'll show PROXY=localhost:923 or something similar, try unset PROXY and then try from that terminal
it's still not working. i still get the same error
so the proxy isn't an environment variable?
it is, and it worked yesterday, but it's like everytime i cut it off it simply comes back on. I have no idea why it's not working now, it fixed it yesterday.
i would get you a pastebin of the error....but it keeps saying it's spam...>_>
http://p.defau.lt/?DWNRGBUEoCaoxdD8cXYR2A
is that from a console?
no that's from the update manager
hmmmmm now THAT'S odd. running "sudo apt-get update" in terminal works fine. but it won't work in the update manager.
evironment variables are inherited and when you set it system wide it didn't get passed down to the updater applet
how do i pass it down then?
